maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: Microsoft SQL Server on Windows (Views) Management Pack contains views and folder structure for Microsoft SQL Server on Windows management packs. This Management Pack depends on Microsoft SQL Server on Windows (Discovery) Management Pack and Microsoft SQL Server Core Library (Views) Management Pack.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The SQL Broker Performance report displays one chart with these performance items:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Activation Task Limit Reached per sec
Statistics Enqueued Transport Msgs per sec
Activation Stored Procedures Invoked per sec

maml:section.maml:para: The report finds data if the objects supplied are of type "MSSQL on Windows: DB Engine"
The report displays for every selected object a separate chart. Data is aggregated to days of a month.
When run from the Reporting space:
The second column in the search results shows of which type the displayed objects are. Make sure you select objects of type SQL DB Engine.
When run from the Monitoring space:
Create a state view or performance view by choosing the “MSSQL on Windows: DB Engine” type.
Date/Time selection: Allows selecting a relative or fixed date and time range and time zone.
Object: Allows adding objects to run this report.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The SQL Database Engine Counters report displays one chart with these performance items:
When choosing objects to run this report against be aware of the following

maml:listItem.maml:para: The report will only show data for classes of type "MSSQL on Windows: DB Engine" that represent SQL on Windows installations.
The most direct way to run this report against all SQL DB Engine instances is to click "Add Group..." and to select the "MSSQL on Windows: SQL Server Computers"

You can also use the "Add Object..." button to choose particular DB Engine instances that you wish to run the report against, but you will need to know the names of those instances for this report to work.

maml:section.maml:para: The report displays for every selected object a separate chart. Data is aggregated to days of a month.
When run from the Reporting space:
The second column in the search results shows of which type the displayed objects are. Make sure you select objects of type MSSQL on Windows: DB Engine.
When run from the Monitoring space:
Create a state view or performance view by choosing the “MSSQL on Windows: DB Engine” type.
Date/Time selection: Allows selecting a relative or fixed date and time range and time zone.
Object: Allows adding objects to run this report.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The SQL database space report displays several chart with these performance items:

maml:listItem.maml:para: In-Memory OLTP Data Disk Used Space (MB)
In-Memory OLTP Data Disk Free Space (%)

maml:section.maml:para: The report finds data if the objects supplied are of type "MSSQL on Windows: Database".
Search for objects with contains and (e.g. “Database 1")
The report displays for every selected object a separate chart. Data is aggregated to days of a month.
When run from the Reporting space:
The second column in the search results shows of which type the displayed objects are. Make sure you select objects of type SQL Database.
When run from the Monitoring space:
Create a state view or performance view by choosing the “MSSQL on Windows: Database” type.
Date/Time selection: Allows selecting a relative or fixed date and time range and time zone.
Object: Allows adding objects to run this report.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The Database Files Space Usage Forecast report displays several charts with the following performance items:
The report finds data if the objects supplied are of type "MSSQL on Windows: DB Engine".
The report displays a separate chart for every selected object or a group of objects. Note that this report works with Windows objects only.
1. Open the report menu in the Operations Manager.
2. Add an object or a group of objects to the report.
3. Select the period and the corresponding time zone for the report.
4. Select the number of days for the consumption forecast.
5. Click Run button. The report data will be displayed.
Date/Time selection: Allows selecting a relative or fixed date and time range and time zone.
Object: Allows adding objects to run this report.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The SQL Lock Analysis report displays one chart with these performance items:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Number of Lock Waits Per Second
Number of Lock Requests Per Second

maml:section.maml:para: The report finds data if the objects supplied are of type "MSSQL on Windows: DB Engine".
Search for objects with contains and (e.g. “Instance 1”)
The report displays for every selected object a separate chart. Data is show in hours per day for peak hours (7am-7pm).
When run from the Reporting space:
The second column in the search results shows of which type the displayed objects are. Make sure you select objects of type SQL DB Engine.
When run from the Monitoring space:
Create a state view or performance view by choosing the “MSSQL on Windows: DB Engine” type.
Date/Time selection: Allows selecting a relative or fixed date and time range and time zone.
Object: Allows adding objects to run this report.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The SQL Server Configuration report displays these discovered properties:
The report finds data if the objects supplied are of type "MSSQL on Windows: DB Engine".
Search for objects with contains and the Instance name (e.g. “Instance1”)
The report displays a matrix detailing all the found properties.
When run from the Reporting space:
The second column in the search results shows of which type the displayed objects are. Make sure you select objects of type SQL DB Engine.
When run from the Monitoring space:
Create a state view or performance view by choosing the “MSSQL on Windows: DB Engine” type.
Date/Time selection: Allows selecting a relative or fixed date and time range and time zone.
Object: Allows adding objects to run this report.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The Top5 Deadlocked databases report displays one chart that shows the top 5 deadlocked databases and a tabled detailing the databases and the counter values.

The report displays a blue column for the number of deadlocks in the chosen period. The black error bar indicates the fluctuation of the counter during the reporting range. If the Error bar is small, the counter has always been around the Top value, if it is large the database had a wider varying number of deadlocks.
Date/Time selection: Allows selecting a relative or fixed date and time range and time zone.
Management Group: Allows to choose the Management Group to run this report.
